page.title: 12German Defences in St.Ouen's
page.content: During the German occupation an anti-aircrapt gun battery was constructed at Les Landes. The battery was codenamed {Batterie Moltke . In 1944, plans were prepared for the battery to be turned into a full blown naval battery. This was never completed. To avoid abuse of the ammunition tunnel complex, the installions have been filled in and covered with earth. A major observation tower was built on the cliff tops overlooking the sea. The tower was codenamed {MP3}. Since the end of the Occupation, the tower has been abandoned and all the interior fittings are gone. But the vast concrete structure will stand for centuries unless deliberately destroyed.
